page.title: 02YALDING DISTRICT BUILDINGS
page.content: Notable buildings include the mainly medieval parish churches of Yalding and Nettlestead, Nettlestead Place with a fine 13th century vaulted undercroft, West Farleigh Hall (early Georgian), and Tutsham Hall, West Farleigh, Buston Manor, Hunton, and in Yalding, Cleaves (1663), Court Lodge (circa 1690), Church House and 18th century Kenward House. Yalding High Street has fine buildings, many being timber framed. Particularly attractive are Randalls Cottages with white weatherboarded fronts and thatched roofs, the only thatch left in the High Street. Several outbuildings of Court Lodge Farm are now houses and several oast houses in the area have been converted to houses. On Yalding Village Green is preserved the lock- up (1786) to hold offenders overnight.
